title: Park for everyone in your family... Disneyland of West Bengal…
review_text:
A perfect family picnic spot. It has both a good number of normal games and also water sports. Kids and elders both can enjoy the day and the 35 different rides. the Toy Train, Tilt-a-Whirl, Magic Carpet, Paddle Boat, Water Chute, Water Coaster, Flying Saucer, Pirate Ship, River Caves, Cyclone, and Moonraker. The Giant Cyclone, added in 2003, is among Asia's largest. The ride 750 meters in length, has seven drops and goes as high as 55 feet. 

I also saw Eiffel tower replica there. not sure when climbing up was allowed or not. The park has also constructed a water park, Wet-O-Wild, inside the amusement park(I guess better water park than Aquatica). There is also a rain dance performance. The park also has a 4-D movie theater. 
They run a lot of packages also. I guess entry fee is around Rs 200. 
Food court and normal food stall are available inside. Avoid going on holidays, or you have to wait for rides More

title: NICCO PARK
review_text:
Nicco Park is the most visited and the oldest amusement park of Kolkata. Spread over an area of 40 acres the park is situated in the Salt Lake region of the city. Often regarded as the Disneyland of the City of Joy, the park is known for its adventure rides. 

The park was opened in 1991 when it was named as Jheel Meel. Full of entertainment and adventure options for all age groups Nicco Park is one of the biggest amusement parks in India. 

Besides several adventure rides, the park also houses lakes and gardens, which are good for boating and family picnics. 

The large Food Park serves Bengali, Chinese, North Indian and South Indian dishes. There are a wide variety of activities for children and young people. Rides like Cable Car, Water Chute, Pirate Ship, Tilt-a-Whirl, Toy Train, Flying Saucer, Moonraker and Water Coaster are popular among people of all age groups. The special attraction of Nicco Park is the Cave Ride. More

title: Take your children along
review_text:

title: Not worth visiting anymore.
review_text: It has become a money churning place. The condition of the place is in shambles. In the name of Carnival, the same things are repeated year after year. The gardens & lawns are not maintained. The place was once known for it's cleanliness, now it's filth all around. The garbage disposal bins are overflowing & the crows are strewing the same all across the place. No one is there to supervise. The condition of the rides are equally bad & I can recall accidents taking place some time back. The entry fees have been hiked exorbitantly & I recall it started with Rs. 5/- when I visited first as a young boy. The quality of the food is poor & flies are infested at the food court. I am sure the kitchen area is much worse where common visitors are not allowed. It's very unfortunate for a place once the city boasted about has gone for a toss for reasons best known to the management. More

title: Only standard amusement park in Kolkata
review_text:
Though Kolkata is a metro city, it has only one amusement park - that is Nicco park. This is not world class. Probably even not closer to the most popular ones in India. But being the only one it's surely one getaway for the adventure and fun seekers in Kolkata. 

The entry fee is bit on the higher side as there are very few free rides. They can rise the fee for the individual rides like Cyclone, River Cave, Water Coaster etc. But these rides are really good. Cyclone is probably India's best wooden roller coaster. More
